data.question: What is the name of the chromium-based metal–organic framework reported for N2/O2 separation?
What is the N2 capture capacity of TYUT-96Cr?
How does TYUT-96Cr compare to commercial sorbents like Li-LSX and 13X in terms of N2/O2 selectivity?
data.answer: TYUT-96Cr has a higher N2/O2 selectivity up to 26.95, setting new benchmarks compared to Li-LSX and 13X.

data.question: True or False: The high-density open Cr (III) sites in TYUT-96Cr act as effective Lewis acidic sites.
What is the purity level of O2 produced by TYUT-96Cr from various N2/O2 mixtures?
True or False: TYUT-96Cr exhibits the highest N2 volume adsorption capacity among all examined MOFs at 298 K and 1 bar.
What is the role of Cr (III) unsaturated sites in TYUT-96Cr?
data.answer: They are key to binding gas molecules, especially for preferential interactions with N2.

data.question: True or False: TYUT-96Cr's structure includes three forms of metal sites.
What is the BET surface area of TYUT-96Cr?
True or False: The N2 adsorption capacity of TYUT-96Cr is significantly higher than that of MIL-100Cr and Li-LSX at low pressure.
What is the N2/O2 (5:95, v/v) selectivity of TYUT-96Cr?
True or False: TYUT-96Cr remains stable up to 648 K.
What is the gravimetric value of Cr (III) unsaturated sites in TYUT-96Cr?
True or False: The synthesis of TYUT-96Cr was first reported without its structure being determined.
What is the chemical formula of TYUT-96Cr?
True or False: TYUT-96Cr's chemical stability was confirmed by maintaining crystallinity after soaking in various conditions.
What is the N2 adsorption enthalpy (Qst) of TYUT-96Cr?
True or False: TYUT-96Cr exhibits two kinds of activate open Cr (III) sites.
What is the role of in situ infrared spectroscopy analysis in the study of TYUT-96Cr?
data.answer: It was used to demonstrate the fundamental binding mechanism of TYUT-96Cr for the recognition of N2.

data.question: True or False: TYUT-96Cr has been demonstrated to be the best separating material for the separation of N2 from N2/O2 mixtures.
